definition: to treat the symptoms but not the root cause
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
(negative prefix)/not/no
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: But such bond-buying is a temporary palliative.
sentences.chinese: 但这种债券买法治标不治本。

sentences.english: Scotch tape may solve the problem temporarily, but it cannot take the problem away.
sentences.chinese: 胶纸或许能暂时地解决问题，但是它治标不治本。

sentences.english: A bailout will not address the fundamental causes of Greece's fiscal problems.
sentences.chinese: 金援对于希腊的财政问题来说只是治标不治本。

sentences.english: “Caring is good, but it treats the symptoms without addressing the root cause of the problem,” says Ye Jingzhong.
sentences.chinese: 叶精忠说，“关爱是好的，但这治标不治本。”

sentences.english: “Caring is good, but it treats the symptoms without addressing the root cause of the problem, ” says Ye Jingzhong.
sentences.chinese: 叶精忠说，“关爱是好的，但这治标不治本。”
这样的行动是治标不治本的。

sentences.english: However, these ways could not deal with the true problem.
sentences.chinese: 这些解决办法治标不治本，没有抓住问题的实质。

sentences.english: But critics say the circular only "scratches the surface of a problem".
sentences.chinese: 但是评论家们认为该项通知“治标不治本”。

definition: to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
to take radical measures/to get to the root (of a problem etc)
to bring under permanent control/to effect a radical cure
to eradicate
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
to treat the symptoms rather than getting to the root of the problem (proverb)/reactive (rather than proactive)
pinyin: tou2 tong4 yi1 tou2 , jiao3 tong4 yi1 jiao3

definition: lit. set up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); fig. instant effect/quick results
to get sth done once and for all
lit. put up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); to expect instant results
to have the desired effect
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
ineradicable disease/fig. deep-seated problem/perennial problem
to no avail/achieving nothing/totally ineffective/to have no effect/to fall flat (esp. of joke or speech that is completely ignored)
efficacious/useful
